pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:1.21: _Pavārito_, often translated as “invited”, but the word also means “satisfied”. In the present case, the contextual meaning (see below) is that the monk has expressed his satisfaction after being invited to take more.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.1.10: _Akappiyakataṃ hoti_, lit. “It is done with what is not allowable.” The “it”, both here and below, refers to the ceremony of making it allowable, and the “what” refers to the food.
